{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Production Quality Controller",
  "description": "Benin Asaba Expressway is the holding company for the Concession Project awarded to APP(Africa Plus Partners Benin Asaba Expressway is the holding company for the Concession Project awarded to African Plus Partners by the Federal government of Nigeria to construct, maintain and manage the Benin Asaba Expressway.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Quality Controller
Job Location:&nbsp;Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Contract

Job Purpose


	The Production Quality Controller is responsible for ensuring that production of asphalt, concrete, GSB, and CSBC meets design specifications and FMWH standards.


Job Description


	Verify mix designs for asphalt and concrete.
	Conduct trial mixes and monitor plant calibrations.
	Perform routine testing (Marshall Stability, slump, cube strength, gradation).
	Approve or reject production batches.


Requirements


	B.Sc Civil / Materials Engineering.
	5 &ndash; 8 years of experience in production QA/QC.


Skills &amp; Competence:


	Strong testing and verification knowledge.
	Familiarity with laboratory and field testing equipment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated&nbsp;CV to:&nbsp;hr@baexpressway.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Production Quality Controller Job at Benin Asaba Expressway




        
    

        
        Benin Asaba Expressway is the holding company for the Concession Project awarded to APP(Africa Plus Partners Benin Asaba Expressway is the holding company for the Concession Project awarded to African Plus Partners by the Federal government of Nigeria to construct, maintain and manage the Benin Asaba Expressway.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Quality Controller
Job Location: Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Contract

Job Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Production Quality Controller is responsible for ensuring that production of asphalt, concrete, GSB, and CSBC meets design specifications and FMWH standards.


Job Description


	Verify mix designs for asphalt and concrete.
	Conduct trial mixes and monitor plant calibrations.
	Perform routine testing (Marshall Stability, slump, cube strength, gradation).
	Approve or reject production batches.


Requirements


	B.Sc Civil / Materials Engineering.
	5 – 8 years of experience in production QA/QC.


Skills & Competence:


	Strong testing and verification knowledge.
	Familiarity with laboratory and field testing equipment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: hr@baexpressway.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marine Operations Manager",
  "description": "Rotawn Energy and Logistics Services Limited was established in 2007 as an indigenous Nigerian company offering tailor-made solutions to the Oil &amp; Gas, Maritime and Government Sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marine Operations Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt - Rivers / Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily vessel and marine operations, ensuring optimal performance and readiness.
	Ensure compliance with ISM Code, ISPS Code, flag state regulations, classification society requirements, and client-specific standards.
	Supervise and provide direction to the Technical Superintendent, HSE Manager, Captains, and Engineers.
	Manage offshore support services, logistics, and coordination of marine assets to meet operational needs.
	Monitor and evaluate crew performance, providing guidance, training, and support to maintain high standards.
	Develop, implement, and review operational procedures to enhance safety, efficiency, and regulatory compliance.
	Prepare and present reports on vessel readiness, operational KPIs, and incident/accident statistics to the General Manager.
	Liaise with clients, port authorities, and regulatory agencies to ensure smooth operations.
	Manage operational budgets and ensure cost-effective use of resources.
	Lead initiatives for continuous improvement in marine operations and safety culture.


Requirements


	Experience: 3-5 years.
	Strong knowledge of ISM/ISPS codes, STCW regulations, and offshore support services.


Core Competencies:


	Leadership &amp; People Management
	Operational &amp; Technical Expertise
	Safety &amp; Compliance Orientation
	Strategic Planning &amp; Reporting
	Communication &amp; Client Relations


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and all reletated certificates to:&nbsp;recruitment@rotawn.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates should apply.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Marine Operations Manager Job at Rotawn Energy & Logistics Services Limited




        
    

        
        Rotawn Energy and Logistics Services Limited was established in 2007 as an indigenous Nigerian company offering tailor-made solutions to the Oil & Gas, Maritime and Government Sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marine Operations Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt - Rivers / Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee daily vessel and marine operations, ensuring optimal performance and readiness.
	Ensure compliance with ISM Code, ISPS Code, flag state regulations, classification society requirements, and client-specific standards.
	Supervise and provide direction to the Technical Superintendent, HSE Manager, Captains, and Engineers.
	Manage offshore support services, logistics, and coordination of marine assets to meet operational needs.
	Monitor and evaluate crew performance, providing guidance, training, and support to maintain high standards.
	Develop, implement, and review operational procedures to enhance safety, efficiency, and regulatory compliance.
	Prepare and present reports on vessel readiness, operational KPIs, and incident/accident statistics to the General Manager.
	Liaise with clients, port authorities, and regulatory agencies to ensure smooth operations.
	Manage operational budgets and ensure cost-effective use of resources.
	Lead initiatives for continuous improvement in marine operations and safety culture.


Requirements


	Experience: 3-5 years.
	Strong knowledge of ISM/ISPS codes, STCW regulations, and offshore support services.


Core Competencies:


	Leadership & People Management
	Operational & Technical Expertise
	Safety & Compliance Orientation
	Strategic Planning & Reporting
	Communication & Client Relations


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and all reletated certificates to: recruitment@rotawn.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates should apply.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "ASP.NET Developer (MVC)",
  "description": "Software Business Solutions Consulting(SBSC) is a Technology and Management Consulting company that specializes in developing custom software to meet the business objectives of organizations. We have extensive experience working in various sectors of the economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;ASP.NET Developer (MVC)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;

Job Description


	We are looking for an ASP.NET MVC developer who can develop and support existing applications.
	The main scope of work will include everything from back-end to client-side code, using optimal and efficient technologies, frameworks, and patterns.
	Your primary responsibilities will be to design and develop these applications. Therefore, it&rsquo;s essential that you are skilled at problem-solving, solution design, and high-quality coding.


Responsibilities


	Delivering a high-quality application
	Integrating with front-end developers
	Ensuring a required level of performance
	Writing test-backed server-side code
	Analyzing requirements and designing new functionality
	Supporting and fixing existing functionality
	Selecting and using the most appropriate and efficient technologies for a particular application
	Designing and building application layers.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-22",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-23",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Software Business Solutions Consulting"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189208"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



ASP.NET Developer (MVC) Job at Software Business Solutions Consulting




        
    

        
        Software Business Solutions Consulting(SBSC) is a Technology and Management Consulting company that specializes in developing custom software to meet the business objectives of organizations. We have extensive experience working in various sectors of the economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: ASP.NET Developer (MVC)

Job Location: Lagos 

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an ASP.NET MVC developer who can develop and support existing applications.
	The main scope of work will include everything from back-end to client-side code, using optimal and efficient technologies, frameworks, and patterns.
	Your primary responsibilities will be to design and develop these applications. Therefore, it’s essential that you are skilled at problem-solving, solution design, and high-quality coding.


Responsibilities


	Delivering a high-quality application
	Integrating with front-end developers
	Ensuring a required level of performance
	Writing test-backed server-side code
	Analyzing requirements and designing new functionality
	Supporting and fixing existing functionality
	Selecting and using the most appropriate and efficient technologies for a particular application
	Designing and building application layers.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Store Manager",
  "description": "Kadick Integrated Limited is a dynamic and forward-thinking company operating in the fintech and telecom sectors. We provide innovative digital solutions, agency banking services, and retail distribution across Nigeria. At Kadick, we are committed to driving financial inclusion, empowering communities, and delivering exceptional value to our partners and customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Manager

Job Location: Ajah,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Store Manager to oversee the daily operations of our Fashion store
	The ideal candidate will be passionate about fashion retail, customer experience, and operational excellence.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and motivate the store team to achieve sales and service goals.
	Make strategic decisions to drive business growth and improve customer satisfaction.
	Oversee inventory management, stock levels, and visual displays.
	Ensure smooth daily operations, including opening/closing procedures and store upkeep.
	Implement promotions and merchandising strategies to boost sales and revenue.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in retail or fashion store management.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and ability to multitask.
	Must reside within or close to Ajah/Sangotedo.
	We encourage qualified male candidates to apply as part of our efforts to promote gender balance within the team.


Salary
N300,000 - N450,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@kadickintegrated.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Store Manager&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

  },

}



Store Manager Job at Kadick Integrated Limited




        
    

        
        Kadick Integrated Limited is a dynamic and forward-thinking company operating in the fintech and telecom sectors. We provide innovative digital solutions, agency banking services, and retail distribution across Nigeria. At Kadick, we are committed to driving financial inclusion, empowering communities, and delivering exceptional value to our partners and customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Manager

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Store Manager to oversee the daily operations of our Fashion store
	The ideal candidate will be passionate about fashion retail, customer experience, and operational excellence.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and motivate the store team to achieve sales and service goals.
	Make strategic decisions to drive business growth and improve customer satisfaction.
	Oversee inventory management, stock levels, and visual displays.
	Ensure smooth daily operations, including opening/closing procedures and store upkeep.
	Implement promotions and merchandising strategies to boost sales and revenue.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in retail or fashion store management.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and ability to multitask.
	Must reside within or close to Ajah/Sangotedo.
	We encourage qualified male candidates to apply as part of our efforts to promote gender balance within the team.


Salary
N300,000 - N450,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@kadickintegrated.com using “Store Manager” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
